original_theorem:
If $\mathbf{X}_1$ and $\mathbf{X}_2$ are in $S_r(\mathbf{X}_0)$ for some $r>0$,
then so is every point on
the line segment from $\mathbf{X}_1$ to $\mathbf{X}_2.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem convexity_of_open_ball
    {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E]
    {x₀ x₁ x₂ : E} {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r)
    (h₁ : x₁ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) (h₂ : x₂ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) :
    segment ℝ x₁ x₂ ⊆ Metric.ball x₀ r := by
```

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convexity_of_open_ball
    {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E]
    {x₀ x₁ x₂ : E} {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r)
    (h₁ : x₁ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) (h₂ : x₂ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) :

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• Let V be a real normed vector space, and let $\mathbf{X}_0, \mathbf{X}_1, \mathbf{X}_2$ be points in V [tc_1].
• Let t be a real number such that $0 < t < 1$. We define a point $\mathbf{X}$ on the line segment between $\mathbf{X}_1$ and $\mathbf{X}_2$ as $\mathbf{X} = t\mathbf{X}_2 + (1-t)\mathbf{X}_1$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any t such that $0 < t < 1$, $|\mathbf{X} - \mathbf{X}_0| = |t(\mathbf{X}_2 - \mathbf{X}_0) + (1-t)(\mathbf{X}_1 - \mathbf{X}_0)|$ [l1].

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convexity_of_open_ball
    {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E]
    {x₀ x₁ x₂ : E} {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r)
    (h₁ : x₁ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) (h₂ : x₂ ∈ Metric.ball x₀ r) :
    segment ℝ x₁ x₂ ⊆ Metric.ball x₀ r := by

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• Let V be a real normed vector space, and let $\mathbf{X}_0, \mathbf{X}_1, \mathbf{X}_2$ be points in V [tc_1].
• For any real number t such that $0 < t < 1$, we define a point $\mathbf{X}$ as $\mathbf{X} = t\mathbf{X}_2 + (1-t)\mathbf{X}_1$ [def_1].
• For any t such that $0 < t < 1$, the expression for $|\mathbf{X} - \mathbf{X}_0|$ is $|t(\mathbf{X}_2 - \mathbf{X}_0) + (1-t)(\mathbf{X}_1 - \mathbf{X}_0)|$ [l1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• For any t such that $0 < t < 1$, $|t(\mathbf{X}_2 - \mathbf{X}_0) + (1-t)(\mathbf{X}_1 - \mathbf{X}_0)| \le t|\mathbf{X}_2-\mathbf{X}_0| + (1-t)|\mathbf{X}_1-\mathbf{X}_0|$ [l2].
